title: khiholangkang
author: khiholangkang
content: SourceLook at the M2 money supply in the dollar continues to grow every year and it will weaken the FIAT currency, in the case of FIAT currencies all have the same mechanism and the certainty is that with the increase in supply it will reduce the value of your money, and will you continue to keep your FIAT and let it lose its value, why not just keep your money in bitcoin? Even though you know that Bitcoin has fluctuations, you can still believe that Bitcoin will always fight Inflation and maintain and increase the value of Bitcoin, OR IN OTHER WORDS PRESERVE AND ADD TO YOUR WEALTH IN THE LONG TERM.Don't let the results of your hard work swallowed by this system.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Fiat is flawed, sure. But the way things are right now, Bitcoin is a gamble, not some magic fix. So, pick your poison.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Quote from: khiholangkang on March 16, 2025, 07:04:58 PMwhy not just keep your money in bitcoin? As much as we want to tell everybody to save in BTC, it's because not everyone is oriented about it and that's why we need to rely on ourselves in saving Bitcoin. We have been telling those that are not yet convinced about saving in BTC that their fiat is being lessened down by the inflation. I think we all agree with that and they need to think of it as soon as they are seeing the rapid price increase of commodities. And another reason might be that, it's just that they are not fond of this type of investment and asset. They're the old traditionals that will keep themselves safe from the trouble of how highly volatile Bitcoin is and on how they only will rely to the old investments they know. I.E stocks, gold, etc.

comments.author: BABY SHOES
comments.body: Many people believe in Fiat even though its value has been weakened by inflation every year.Maybe we think bitcoin is a store of value for the future... I agree with this but at least I still hold a little fiat for necessity.But at least there are assets stored in bitcoin in the long run, this can be a retirement fund or for children's education later.But many parents now still don't understand about bitcoin they are better off keeping the value mostly in gold.But the younger generation is more in bitcoin.

comments.author: Smartprofit
comments.body: Yes, storing your capital in Bitcoin is certainly a great idea. Unlike fiat money, Bitcoin is a deflationary currency, meaning that over time, in the long term, its price will rise. Therefore, you can simply ignore the volatility of the Bitcoin price. Bitcoin transactions are not censored. Currently, commercial banks do not so much help their customers with financial matters as they serve the interests of government financial regulators. A commercial bank can freeze your funds, but this will not happen with Bitcoin. No government can order Satoshi Nakamoto to impose financial and economic sanctions on certain Bitcoin users. However, storing Bitcoin and ensuring the safety of coins is a personal headache for the holder. He must be competent enough to keep his coins safe.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: You know that saving any free funds one has in their possession regularly, may not follow a particular sequence and that's why a more informed and organized approach called the DCA strategy is often cited for emphasis and adoption.A free strategy of saving BTC would be the lump sum strategy where one would buy at intervals based on their discretion or sudden availability of cash. Still, the best advice is to save funds you would not need urgently in BTC and a long term plan is often more rewarding than a short term savings plan where the funds may be liquidated or diversified.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Sure I will, if I can pay my rent in bitcoin, to pay for my fuel, to pay everything that I spent fiat on. So we knew what is the actual problem even if you are in the complete favor of bitcoin.Bitcoin should be accepted everywhere as payment before we even talk about removing the fiat from it's existence. Even when we have merchants and customers are ready with their bitcoin now we got scalability issue, bitcoin network is not really made to process thousands of transactions per second.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Many people already do that. The thing is, putting all of your savings in btc is equally dangerous. What you want is a diversified portfolio. Put some btc, gold, stocks, bonds and even FIAT in it and youâ€™ll have a financial fortress which will survive any catastrophic environment. Gold has been doing great lately. FIAT is crap in the long run but you still want to have some because we buy stuff with FIAT and market crashes happen all the time.How about,30% btc10% cash10% gold40% stocks10% bonds ?That looks diversified enough.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on March 16, 2025, 07:20:55 PMFiat is flawed, sure. But the way things are right now, Bitcoin is a gamble, not some magic fix. So, pick your poison.Sure Bitcoin is a gamble as one can hold a percentage of Bitcoin as savings and lose significantly if the price goes against your bought price and sometimes the losses can be highly significant even more than the amount your Fiat will lose to inflation if saved in the bank, but then also we still prefer Bitcoin regardless if and when we understand the risk and requirements that come with Bitcoin investment, and before you save in Bitcoin you should be prepared to wait for some time if you see that the market trends are going against your position. But if you talk of holding Bitcoin's position on future trades as an asset yeah I agree doing so is the same as gambling with your money and one can lose at any point in time.

comments.author: Alone055
comments.body: Quote from: mindrust on March 16, 2025, 08:08:17 PMHow about,30% btc10% cash10% gold40% stocks10% bonds ?What about real estate? People who have enough wealth should definitely add real estate to their portfolio because it is one of the most profitable investment industries anywhere in the world. When inflation rises, the value of your real estate assets will boom as well, and even in bad economic situations, you will still have a high-value portfolio this way.@OP says Bitcoin can save our wealth from depreciating or losing purchasing power over time, but he probably forgot the fact that Bitcoin is a volatile asset itself, it gains and loses value over time, so it is not a complete solution and we need things that we can hold which won't make our whole portfolio lose value if one market crashes.Gold, Bitcoin, and Real Estate, these are what I would prefer. Take out real estate only if you think you don't have that much money, only choose gold and Bitcoin, and keep some cash as well.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Not all people are into bitcoin so it's only natural that they pick fiat when they save money. If all people know bitcoin then why do you think that there's still people who use banks to get money or withdraw money?. For people who know cryptocurreny then they will buy more than one crypto to have diversity on their investment. There's always risk in crypto so if I have lots of money then I would do the same which own more than one crypto.

But if you talk of holding Bitcoin's position on future trades as an asset yeah I agree doing so is the same as gambling with your money and one can lose at any point in time.If you are trading BTCUSDT, BTCUSDC and others in derivatives market, you are not trading bitcoin but trading bitcoin derivative pairs. It is different from trading bitcoin which is BTC/USDT and others. This thread is about bitcoin in the spot market which is BTC/USDT and others and not about the derivative market which is not bitcoin but its derivatives.As for me, bitcoin is not gambling if you understand the market. There are time to buy which will be good for holders to take the opportunity. I see bitcoin more as a speculative asset. If you are able to speculate the market very well, you will not lose but make money from bitcoin holding.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Ah yeah, Bitcoin has that limited supply thing going for it. So, in theory, it could be a good way to keep your money safe from inflation. But you are acting like Bitcoin is a sure thing. Like its guaranteed to go up and fight inflation. But its not. Its super volatile. Â You say "just keep your money in Bitcoin." But what if you need that money right now and its value suddenly drops? You could lose a lot! Its risky.

comments.author: AprilioMP
comments.body: As far as I know about the performance of the Fiat currency, I agree that if you keep it for a long time it will not make the owner calm because of its value that will continue to decline in value due to inflation.No wonder the way to save it must be changed to investment. Most people choose the type of gold investment because it can maintain value to the Fiat currency.No wonder about the continued increase in fiat money every period (I do not call it every year) because of the need. We also need it because Fiat is an official currency.Bitcoin is a good choice for hedging for Fiat and some parties even assessed that Bitcoin is better than gold after they conduct research as a long -term value. comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on March 16, 2025, 07:20:55 PMFiat is flawed, sure. But the way things are right now, Bitcoin is a gamble, not some magic fix. So, pick your poison.When it comes to avoiding inflation it's not much of a gamble. Just look at the price of goods and services in fiat vs the same in bitcoin over the last 10 years. What would you save in if you could? Fiat sucks. Bonds and savings accounts suck. You can't pay with gold and you can't easily move or sell real estate. You're left with bitcoin.

And going all in With Bitcoin is too risky Nothing beats diversification Especially on projects that are not correlated Say Bitcoin and Real estate( Though expensive and location) Gold and certain stocks ain't bad.
